title: Jack Hodgin's island
creator_credit: Robert Duncan, Don Hopkins and National Film Board of Canada
brief_description: One of Canada’s most exciting new literary talents, West Coast author Jack Hodgins talks about his world and his work. Using passages from his short stories and novels, the film enters the world of logging camps and saloons, of people and events on Vancouver Island. At times serious, sometimes hilarious, other times introspective, it is a reflection of a storyteller who writes about what goes on around him.
